business.headline: Nirmala Sitharaman calls for 'affordable' interest rates after Piyush GoyalThe Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has kept key interest rates unchanged since February 2023, citing persistent inflation pressures.

Sensex surges 1,000 points, snaps 7-session losing streak. Is the worst over?Stock market today: At 11:36 am, the Sensex was up 1044.89 points at 78,383.90, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 304.50 points to 23,758.30.

ED likely to summon top Amazon, Flipkart executives over FDI rule violationsThe ED's investigation stems from multiple complaints alleging that Amazon and Flipkart have been violating Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) rules by directly or indirectly favouring select vendors.

Boeing to cut over 2,500 workers in US amid financial crisisNearly 2,200 layoff notices went to workers in Washington and another 220 in South Carolina, the two states where Boeing builds commercial airliners. Boeing declined to comment on the layoffs on Monday.

Gold, silver price today, November 19, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today November 19, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Meta to appeal India's Rs 213-crore penalty order over WhatsApp policyThe Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday imposed a penalty of Rs 213.14 crore on social media major Meta for unfair business ways with respect to WhatsApp privacy policy update done in 2021.

NTPC Green Energy IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe initial public offering (IPO) makes NTPC Green Energy the third-largest IPO of the year, following Hyundai Motors India's Rs 28,756 crore IPO and Swiggy's Rs 11,327 crore issue.
Shaktikanta Das' tenure as RBI governor likely to be extended: Report Shaktikanta Das, who has been heading the RBI since December 2018, has already surpassed the typical five-year term.
Market rally: Sensex, Nifty rebound to open higher; RIL gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex added 663.48 points to 78,002.49, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 203.85 points to 23,657.65
Meta fined Rs 213 crore over WhatsApp privacy policy by competition regulatorThe Competition Commission of India has directed Meta to "cease and desist" from anti-competitive practices.
Sensex, Nifty extend losses amid weak rupee and IT sector declineThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to close at 77,339.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 78.90 points to end at 23,453.80.

Will Bitcoin's revival boost India's appetite for cryptos despite high taxes?The crypto market has been riding a wave of optimism following Donald Trump's election as US president, with hopes that his administration will adopt a crypto-friendly stance.

Tata seals deal to acquire 60% of Pegatron's Tamil Nadu iPhone plant: ReportUnder the agreement, Tata will hold a 60% stake in the plant and oversee daily operations, while Pegatron will retain the remaining 40% and provide technical support.

Telangana government announces 100% tax exemption for electric vehiclesThe Telangana government's initiative is a part of its broader electric vehicle policy aimed at creating an eco-friendly transport system while reducing pollution levels in Hyderabad and other urban centres.

Amazon India to move Bengaluru headquarters to cut costs: ReportThe relocation is aimed at reducing costs and will involve vacating 500,000 square feet of office space across 18 floors at the WTC, which is owned by Brigade Enterprises Ltd.

Foxconn tells India recruiters not to ask for marital status in iPhone job adsFoxconn, which employs thousands of women at the iPhone factory at Sriperumbudur, near Chennai, outsources recruitment of assembly-line workers to third-party vendors.

Stock market correction: How bad is the selloff in smallcap and midcap space?Stock Market Correction: Despite aggressive selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) in Indian equities, ICICI Securities recently noted that small-cap and mid-cap indices have shown relative resilience compared to the Nifty.

Gold prices are falling in India but rising globally. 3 reasons whyGold prices have seen a decline, bringing prices closer to lows recorded in September. Globally, however, gold prices have edged higher due to geopolitical and economic factors.

Sensex, Nifty fall as market bloodbath continues. 4 things investors should knowStock market correction: Sensex and Nifty have entered a correction zone, marked by a drop of more than 10% from their recent highs. The sell-off has rattled retail investors, many of whom are now asking a pressing question: Has the market bottomed out, or is there more pain ahead?

Explained: Why Honasa Consumer share price crashed 20% todayHonasa Consumer share price: The sharp drop came after Mamaearth's parent company released its Q2FY25 earnings report, which revealed weaker-than-expected performance.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'Paid Rs 200 to cops': How diesel trucks are flouting Delhi anti-pollution curbsDelhi AQI: With pollution soaring to extremely severe levels in Delhi and despite the implementation of GRAP-4 measures, India Today found that diesel trucks and buses were freely plying on the roads.

Supreme Court grants pre-arrest bail to Malayalam actor Siddique in rape caseThe charges against actor Siddique came as a spate of sexual misconduct allegations rocked the Malayalam film industry earlier this year. During the hearing, the Supreme Court asked the complainant why it took eight years to lodge the complaint.

Canadian police rule out foul play in Sikh woman's death in Walmart ovenA month after a 19-year-old Sikh woman, Gursimran Kaur, was found dead at a Walmart store oven in Canada, police declared her death non-suspicious, finding no evidence of foul play.

Rishabh Pant breaks silence on leaving Delhi Capitals: 'Not about money' IPL Auction: Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, in a surprising move, was not retained by Delhi Capitals ahead of the mega auction. Pant took to social media and said their split was not because of money.

Are Indians driving birth tourism in Canada? Here's the truthIn a video that has gone viral, a Canadian named claimed Indian women were flooding Canada's hospitals for childbirth. This phenomenon is called 'birth tourism', and is aimed at gaining Canadian citizenship for the newborn. But are Indians driving birth tourism in Canada? This is what data says.

Delhi AQI hit 500 in many areas, trains delayed; schools, colleges go online Live Updates Delhi AQI: Air quality across the national capital region has deteriorated, with several air monitoring stations touching the 500-mark (severe plus) on Tuesday morning.

He met his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi on the sidelines of the G20 Summit in Brazil.

Should Delhi even remain India's capital: Shashi Tharoor on worsening pollutionDelhi AQI: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, in yet another attack on the central government for not taking action on Delhi's worsening pollution, said that the government has failed to address the issue despite years of worsening air conditions.

Elon Musk's SpaceX launches India's 4,700-kg GSAT-20 into spaceSpaceX: The Indian satellite, also referred to as GSAT-N2, is too heavy for Isro's own rockets to carry, necessitating the first-ever commercial collaboration between Isro and SpaceX.

Kashmera Shah suffers freak accident in US, husband Krushna Abhishek shares updateKashmera Shah, currently in USA, experienced a 'freak accident', resulting in a major injury. Her husband, Krushna Abhishek, provided a health update, assuring fans she is fine now and is under medical care.

Video: Telangana man saved moments before jumping into river in dramatic rescueA young man who attempted to die by suicide by jumping into the Godavari River in Telangana was rescued in a dramatic effort by locals.

The video captures the man sitting on a bridge at Bhadrachalam while locals persistently urge him to come down. As the conversation continued, a few individuals swiftly intervened, managing to rescue him just moments before he could leap into the river.

Biden, Meloni, Macron among world leaders PM Modi meets at G20 SummitBrazil G20 Summit: The Prime Minister also met his British, Norwegian, Portuguese and Spanish counterparts on Monday, as well as the Indonesian and South Korean Presidents.

Lawrence Bishnoi's brother detained, US may give custody to Canada: SourcesGangster Anmol Bishnoi, who is wanted in India in multiple cases, was taken into custody in California weeks after the Mumbai Police Crime Branch unit initiated the process of his extradition.
Rs 100-crore online trading scam on WhatsApp busted, Chinese man arrestedThe Delhi cyber police said that the accused was involved in online stock trading scams operated through WhatsApp groups.

How Diljit Dosanjh's alcohol dare exposes states' hypocrisyCelebrated Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh was served a notice and barred from singing songs that referred to alcohol at his Hyderabad concert. In Ahmedabad, the singer, a teetotaller, threw a challenge at the states, exposing their double-standards when it came to liquor policy.

Post-party drive, attempt to overtake BMW: Timeline of deadly Dehradun crashPolice said that the Innova covered the 600-meter distance from the bus stop to the accident site in just 13 seconds, a speed exceeding 120 km/h.

Vir Das shares fan's message about his role in their love story: I'm your Sima AuntyIn a post on Instagram, Comedian Vir Das shared a screenshot of a message a fan had sent him in which they detailed how his shows played a special part in their love story.

Composer Shekhar Ravjiani on his vocal paralysis diagnosis: Was destroyed Renowned music composer Shekhar Ravjiani opened up about a significant health scare involving Left Vocal Cord Paresis, which made him lose his voice. He shared his emotional recovery journey on Instagram.

OTD in 2023, Australia win World Cup: When Cummins silenced the Ahmedabad crowdOn this day in 2023:  November 19 will forever echo as a day of heartbreak for Indian cricket, as dreams of glory crumbled before a resolute Australian side that thrived against all odds. In a deafening silence at the world's largest stadium, hope turned to despair as the coveted World Cup slipped away from the home team.

No Shafali Verma as India name squad for women's ODI series in AustraliaDynamic opener Shafali Verma was not picked as India named their 16-member squad for the upcoming three-match women's ODI series against Australia. Raza to lead Zimbabwe in Pakistan T20Is, Criag Ervine captain for ODIsZimbabwe have named their squads for the ODIs and T20Is against Pakistan. Craig Ervine will lead the ODI side while all-rounder Sikandar Raza has been picked as the T20I skipper.

Pakistan ready to ease Team India's concerns, no hybrid model: PCB chiefChampions Trophy stand-off: Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi reiterated that the board is not willing to host the marquee 50-over tournament in a hybrid model. Naqvi said Pakistan is willing to resolve India's concerns. India have refused to travel to Pakistan for the tournament.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
